value.title: Introduction to data modeling in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the basics of data modeling in Power BI, to get you started fast and easy! value.title: Normalizing data: The what, why and how
value.excerpt: Normalizing data in Power BI: The what, why and how  When analyzing data by population, plotting the row data against the geographical location will fail to reveal important patterns when comparing countries with big differences in population and this is when it is useful to normalize the data. Let me

value.title: Part 1: Get Europe's data in Power BI with Eurostat API - @EU_Eurostat
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to get data about Europe in Power BI to boost your market research? Population in Europe, Age and gender, income levels, employment levels, all this is available for you if you connect to Eurostats API.  In this video I will show you how the API works and in the next we will build

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: Refresh Power BI every second or minute!
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how to refresh Power BI every minute or any interval you yet :). As with everything, there are some limitations but it doesnt require a premium license.  #curbal #powerbi  Link to the blog post: https://bigintsolutions.com/2019/03/29/refresh-power-bi-report-every-min-and-show-on-a-tv/

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Debug DAX using Variables in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Marco Russo, from SQL BI, joins Patrick to look at how you can debug DAX using variables in Power BI. value.title: Deployment Pipelines give you more CONTROL (Power BI Premium)
